learning_objectives: Understand that Earth tilts on its axis as it orbits the Sun
Learn how the tilt causes different seasons in different hemispheres
Discover why summer is warm and winter is cold
Explore how seasons affect nature, animals, and people
key_points: Earth is tilted at 23.5 degrees as it goes around the Sun
When the North Pole tilts toward the Sun, it's summer in the northern half
When the North Pole tilts away, it's winter there
The southern half has opposite seasons from the northern half
Seasons happen because sunlight hits Earth at different angles
Animals and plants change their behavior with the seasons
Some places near the equator don't have big seasonal changes
